subject: Politics
title: Economic Triggers
description: A short lesson to help you apply Economic Triggers.

hook.text: Bread prices sparked the French Revolution. Food prices sparked the Arab Spring. Hungry people overthrow governments.

buildup.text: Economic crises â€” inflation, unemployment, food shortages â€” create the desperation that fuels revolt.

discovery.text: The 2008 financial crisis triggered protest movements worldwide: Occupy, the Arab Spring, and European anti-austerity.

twist.text: Rich countries rarely have revolutions. Economic growth is the best insurance against political upheaval.

climax.text: Inequality matters more than poverty. People revolt when they see others thriving while they suffer.

punchline.text: Empty stomachs fill the streets. Economic pain is political dynamite.

quiz.question: What economic factor most commonly triggers revolutions?
options: Crises like inflation, unemployment, and food shortages that create desperation
Equal distribution of resources across society
